abstract: Minnesota Vikings’ proposal for building a $1.1 billion NFL stadium on a Superfund site in Arden Hills, Minn, with the public paying about 60 percent of the cost, faces stiff opposition.
snippet: The Vikings’ proposal for building a $1.1 billion N.F.L. stadium on a Superfund site in Arden Hills, Minn., with the public paying about 60 percent of the cost, has faced stiff opposition.
lead_paragraph: The Vikings’ proposal for building a $1.1 billion N.F.L. stadium on a Superfund site in Arden Hills, Minn., with the public paying about 60 percent of the cost, has faced stiff opposition.

headline.main: Fiscal and Political Shifts Cloud Stadium Push
headline.print_headline: Fiscal and Political Shifts Cloud Stadium Push
headline.seo: Fiscal Worries Cloud Vikings’ Push for Publicly Financed Stadium
